alert.note: Alert for Forrest (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Forrest County through 430 PM CDT... At 359 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sunrise, or near Petal, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Forrest County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
